title: Construction of the Parthenon begins
description: Construction of the Parthenon in Athens begins during the leadership of Pericles, symbolizing the height of Classical Greece.
author: system

title: Battle of Actium
description: Octavian defeats Mark Antony and Cleopatra at Actium, paving the way for the Roman Empire under Augustus.
author: system

title: Great Fire of Rome
description: A massive fire devastates Rome; accounts later implicate Emperor Nero, though historians debate the details.
author: system

title: Charlemagne crowned Emperor
description: Pope Leo III crowns Charlemagne as Emperor in Rome, reviving the title in Western Europe.
author: system

title: Battle of Hastings
description: William the Conqueror defeats Harold II, beginning the Norman conquest of England.
author: system

title: Magna Carta sealed
description: King John of England seals the Magna Carta at Runnymede, influencing constitutional law.
author: system

title: Columbus reaches the Americas
description: Christopher Columbus lands in the Americas during his voyage sponsored by Spain.
author: system

title: Luther’s Ninety-five Theses
description: Martin Luther publishes the Ninety-five Theses, sparking the Protestant Reformation.
author: system

title: Kepler’s laws formulated (approx.)
description: Johannes Kepler begins publishing his laws of planetary motion, transforming astronomy.
author: system

title: Newton’s Principia published
description: Isaac Newton publishes Philosophiæ Naturalis Principia Mathematica, laying foundations of classical mechanics.
author: system

title: U.S. Declaration of Independence
description: The Thirteen Colonies declare independence from Britain, forming the United States of America.
author: system

title: Storming of the Bastille
description: Revolutionaries storm the Bastille in Paris, a key event of the French Revolution.
author: system

title: Napoleon crowns himself Emperor
description: Napoleon Bonaparte crowns himself Emperor of the French at Notre-Dame Cathedral.
author: system

title: Emancipation Proclamation
description: U.S. President Abraham Lincoln issues the Emancipation Proclamation, freeing slaves in Confederate states.
author: system

title: World War I begins
description: Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia, triggering World War I.
author: system

title: Armistice ends World War I
description: An armistice is signed, ending hostilities on the Western Front of World War I.
author: system

title: World War II begins
description: Germany invades Poland, prompting Britain and France to declare war on Germany.
author: system

title: United Nations founded
description: The UN is established to promote international cooperation and prevent future conflicts.
author: system

title: Universal Declaration of Human Rights
description: The UN General Assembly adopts the UDHR, defining fundamental human rights.
author: system

title: Sputnik 1 launched
description: The Soviet Union launches Sputnik 1, the first artificial Earth satellite, starting the Space Age.
author: system

title: First human in space
description: Yuri Gagarin orbits Earth aboard Vostok 1, the first human spaceflight.
author: system

title: Apollo 11 Moon landing
description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin land on the Moon; Armstrong takes the first steps on the lunar surface.
author: system

title: Fall of the Berlin Wall
description: East and West Berliners dismantle parts of the Berlin Wall, symbolizing the end of the Cold War.
author: system

title: Dissolution of the Soviet Union
description: The USSR formally dissolves, ending the Cold War and creating multiple independent states.
author: system

title: September 11 attacks
description: Coordinated terrorist attacks in the U.S. kill nearly 3,000 people and reshape global security policy.
author: system

title: Lehman Brothers bankruptcy
description: Lehman Brothers files for bankruptcy, a pivotal moment in the global financial crisis.
author: system

title: MH370 disappearance
description: Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 disappears en route from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing, sparking massive search efforts.
author: system

title: MH17 shootdown
description: Malaysia Airlines Flight MH17 is shot down over eastern Ukraine; investigations implicate a Buk missile system.
author: system

title: Brexit referendum
description: The United Kingdom votes to leave the European Union.
author: system

title: Death of Stephen Hawking
description: Physicist Stephen Hawking passes away, renowned for work on black holes and cosmology.
author: system

title: WHO notified of pneumonia cases in Wuhan
description: China notifies WHO about cases of pneumonia of unknown cause in Wuhan, later identified as COVID-19.
author: system

title: WHO declares COVID-19 a pandemic
description: WHO declares the COVID-19 outbreak a global pandemic.
author: system

title: First COVID-19 vaccine EUA (U.S.)
description: The FDA issues an Emergency Use Authorization for the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.
author: system

title: NASA Perseverance rover lands on Mars
description: NASA’s Perseverance rover successfully lands in Jezero Crater to search for signs of past life.
author: system
